etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in Philip Miller (1691–1771), horticulturist and writer. From scientific Latin Rondeletia from the name of Guillaume Rondelet, French naturalist + -ia

definitions: An evergreen shrub or small tree of the tropical American genus Rondeletia (family Rubiaceae); especially any of the various kinds cultivated for their clusters of scented tubular flowers, typically red or pink in colour. Also (in form Rondeletia): the genus itself.

notes.text: Valid publication of the genus name: Linnaeus Species plantarum (1753) I. 172.

definitions: A perfume prepared from a mixture of lavender and cloves, and resembling the characteristic scent of rondeletias.
